acs_chan_bias.description: Can be used to increase (or decrease) the likelihood of a specific channel to be selected by the ACS algorithm

airtime_mode.description: Set the airtime policy operating mode

antenna_gain.description: Reduction in antenna gain from regulatory maximum in dBi

band.description: The wireless band thatthe radio shall operate on

basic_rates.description: Set the supported basic rates. Each basic_rate is measured in kb/s. This option only has an effect on ap and adhoc wifi-ifaces.

beacon_int.description: Set the beacon interval. This is the time interval between beacon frames, measured in units of 1.024 ms. hostapd permits this to be set between 15 and 65535. This option only has an effect on ap and adhoc wifi-ifaces

bssid.description: Overrides the MAC address used for the Wi-Fi interface. Warning: if the MAC address specified is a multicast address, this override will fail silently. To avoid this problem, ensure that the mac address specified is a valid unicast mac address

cell_density.description: Configures data rates based on the coverage cell density. Normal configures basic rates to 6, 12, 24 Mbps if legacy_rates is 0, else to 5.5, 11 Mbps. High configures basic rates to 12, 24 Mbps if legacy_rates is 0, else to the 11 Mbps rate. Very High configures 24 Mbps as the basic rate. Supported rates lower than the minimum basic rate are not offered. The basic_rate and supported_rates options overrides this option. 0 = Disabled, 1 = Normal, 2 = High, 3 = Very High

chanbw.description: Specifies a narrow channel width in MHz, possible values are: 5, 10, 20

channel.description: Specifies the wireless channel. “auto” defaults to the lowest available channel, or utilizes the ACS algorithm depending on hardware/driver support

chanlist.description: Use specific channels, when channel is in “auto” mode. This option allows hostapd to select one of the provided channels when a channel should be automatically selected. Channels can be provided as range using hyphen ('-') or individual channels can be specified by space (' ') separated values

country3.description: The third octet of the Country String (dot11CountryString)

country_code.description: Specifies the country code, affects the available channels and transmission powers. For types mac80211 and broadcom a two letter country code is used (EN or DE). The madwifi driver expects a numeric code

disabled.description: When set to 1, wireless network is disabled

distance.description: Distance between the ap and the furthest client in meters

dsss_cck_40.description: DSSS/CCK Mode in 40 MHz allowed in Beacon, Measurement Pilot and Probe Response frames

enable_background_radar.description: This feature allows CAC to be run on dedicated radio RF chains

greenfield.description: Receive Greenfield - treats pre-80211n traffic as noise

he_default_pe_duration.description: The duration of PE field in an HE PPDU in us

he_6ghz_reg_pwr_type.description: This config is to set the 6 GHz Access Point type.

ht_coex.description: Disable honoring 40 MHz intolerance in coexistence flags of stations

htc_vht.description: STA supports receiving a VHT variant HT Control field

hw_mode.description: Legacy way, use the band property instead

ieee80211d.description: Enables IEEE 802.11d country IE (information element) advertisement in beacon and probe response frames. This IE contains the country code and channel/power map. Requires country

ieee80211h.description: This enables radar detection and DFS support

ieee80211w.description: Whether management frame protection (MFP) is enabled

ifname_prefix.description: Default ifname prefix for this radio

iface_max_num_sta.description: Limits the maximum allowed number of associated clients

legacy_rates.description: Allow legacy 802.11b data rates (used by cell_density)

local_pwr_constraint.description: Add Power Constraint element to Beacon and Probe Response frame

macaddr_base.description: Base MAC address used for deriving interface MAC addresses

max_amsdu.description: Maximum A-MSDU length of 7935 octects (3839 octets if option set to 0)

mbssid.description: Multiple BSSID Advertisement in IEEE 802.11ax IEEE Std 802.11ax-2021 added a feature where instead of multiple interfaces  on a common radio transmitting individual Beacon frames, those interfaces can form a set with a common Beacon frame transmitted for all Set minimum permitted max TX power (in dBm) for ACS and DFS channel selection

min_tx_power.description: Set minimum permitted max TX power (in dBm) for ACS and DFS channel selection

mu_beamformee.description: Supports operation as an MU beamformee

mu_beamformer.description: Supports operation as an MU beamformer

num_global_macaddr.description: The number of MACs that this radio can use

no_probe_resp_if_max_sta.description: Do not answer probe requests if iface_max_num_sta was reached

noscan.description: Do not scan for overlapping BSSs in HT40+/- mode.

path.description: Alternative to phy used to identify the device based paths in /sys/devices

phy.description: Name of the phy, as described in board.json

radio.description: Index of the phy radio (for multi-radio PHYs)

require_mode.description: Sets the minimum client capability level mode that connecting clients must support to be allowed to connect

rssi_ignore_probe_request.description: Ignore Probe Request frames if RSSI is below given threshold (in dBm)

rssi_reject_assoc_rssi.description: Reject STA association if RSSI is below given threshold (in dBm)

rx_antenna_pattern.description: Rx antenna pattern does not change during the lifetime of an association

rx_stbc.description: Supports reception of PPDUs using STBC

rxantenna.description: Specifies the antenna for receiving, the value may be driver specific, usually it is 1 for the first and 2 for the second antenna. Specifying 0 enables automatic selection by the driver if supported. This option has no effect if diversity is enabled

spectrum_mgmt_required.description: Set Spectrum Management subfield in the Capability Information field

stationary_ap.description: Stationary AP config indicates that the AP doesn't move hence location data can be considered as always up to date.

supported_rates.description: Set the supported data rates. Each supported rate is measured in kb/s. This option only has an effect on ap and adhoc wifi-ifaces. This must be a superset of the rates set in basic_rate. The minimum basic rate should also be the minimum supported rate. It is recommended to use the cell_density option instead

tx_antenna_pattern.description: Tx antenna pattern does not change during the lifetime of an association

tx_stbc_2by1.description: Supports transmission of at least 2×1 STBC

txantenna.description: Specifies the antenna for transmitting, values are identical to rxantenna

txpower.description: Specifies the maximum desired transmission power in dBm. The actual txpower used depends on regulatory requirements

vht160.description: Supported channel widths. 0 == 160MHz and 80+80 MHz not supported, 1 == 160 MHz supported, 2 == 160MHz and 80+80 MHz supported

vht_link_adapt.description: TA supports link adaptation using VHT variant HT Control field

vht_max_a_mpdu_len_exp.description: Indicates the maximum length of A-MPDU pre-EOF padding that the STA can recv
